name: Alien Breed: Impact
description: Experience the explosive science fiction arcade-shooter that resurrects a much revered franchise in an epic single player and co-op multiplayer campaign.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows&reg XP SP2 or laterProcessor: 2.0+ GHZ Single Core ProcessorMemory: 1GB RAMGraphics: NVIDIA 6800+ or ATI Radeon X700+ Video CardDirectX®: 9.0cHard Drive: 1.5 GBSound: Windows Supported Sound CardOther Requirements: Internet connection required.

reviews.review_text: What I loved: -Engaging combat with an elegant flow (practically glide from room to room gracefully dispatching enemies) -Rich atmosphere, sound design and graphics (For a UE3 game, this is pretty gorgeous). -Unique setpieces within levels (I LOVED the mainframe areas). -Short and sweet (A lot of my time is AFK, you could beat this in half the time if you wanted)  What I was meh about: -Camera is clunky yet manageable (Enemies that flank you make for minor frustration) -Little variety in combat (Same types of enemies, but the combat flow makes up for it) -Doom syndrome (Levels are different, but still similar enough to evoke, for lack of a better word, ennui)  What I disliked: -Cutscenes of little interest (I skipped every single one and it didn't affect my enjoyment in the slightest) -Repetitive mission layout (Go here, activate thing, activate other thing, get key, hold the fort, etc) -Didn't care about the characters (I don't even remember who the protagonist was, let alone care)

I liked this game quite a bit! I've played through the second one as well (Assault). It's a run and gun, isometric alien shoot-em-up. It all takes place on ships infested and breaking apart. You kill aliens, repair and bypass things, explode stuff, and reek havoc in general. The gunplay feels really good because the aliens get knocked down and impacted by gunfire. This makes even the generic machine gun feel good to use because you can keep aliens at bay with its stopping power. I even played the second game occasionally with a controller and it felt pretty good (although I went back to kb/m because of the precision).  The story reads (literally) as a pulp sci-fi comic book, but it's interesting enough to frame the combat. This game makes killing aliens fun :)

Alien Breed is an isometric sci-fi shooter where you independently control the direction your character aims and moves. You maneuver through a series of 5 stages in each episode, collecting weapons and items, and shooting aliens as they appear while you move from objective to objective provided on your mini-map.  It is difficult to write a separate review for each Episode, as they all largely play the same - you move from point A to point B to pick up access code C to open door D to get to point E to get access code F to.....you get the picture. Lots of backtracking through same-looking corridors, fighting similar looking enemies which pop out of the floor and walls.  It's fun, but only moderately so - I would NOT recommend playing through a single episode in one sitting, let alone all three episodes. The gameplay is repetitive and it's the sort of thing you'll want to put down for a while between sessions (I'd actually say on the level of months between episodes) so it doesn't get stale.

Definitely worth the money. This game scratches the itch that Alien Swarm's short campaign left.  The item system works well, the alien spawns and objectives feel exciting, and the plot is delivered via loading scenes styled like a comic book with dialogue.

Fun third person shooter with the sci-fi alien theme. Collect items, find more ammunition and grenades and make your way through the facility to save yourself and the colony. Good graphics, good controls, and good solid action gameplay.

A very decent twin-stick shooter. This game really does a lot of things right, but unfortunately falls just short of being a great game. Let's start off with the premise of this game. You are a battle hardened engineer (which I'm not sure those words go together) who is traveling on the massive ship, the Leopold. You've just come out of a warp jump and your ship slams into a gigantic vessel that dwarfs your own. Blah blah blah etc etc etc you can find out the rest in game, but the idea is basically having to go around and fix an enormous amount of problems that seem to never end on the Leopold, all while fighting off thousands of this never before seen alien species. Nothing too original for the plot, and when it comes to the aliens, obviously borrows a lot from the Alien movies (which is not a bad thing).  Now onto the game itself. We'll go ahead and start with what the game does great and that is the graphics and environment. The game looks phenomenal for it's price point and for when it was made. The unreal engine in use here really shows off it's stuff as every room and enemy is very, very detailed. Even the action itself looks downright awesome. It's hard to get tired of obliterating countless aliens whenever the guns look this amazing in action. Of particular note, the flamethrower looks incredible, and so do all of the fire physics. The environment differences between the Leopold and the alien vessel are also a drastic shift. While most of the electronics, doors, and corridors look the same (which raises a lot of questions), the alien vessel feels much more ancient and powerful than the Leopold just from the environmental shift.  After that though, the game does start to falter. The story is subpar throughout this first episode, but I will admit curiousity as to where that alien ship came from, and in general where those aliens came from. After reading the logs, they speak of genetic experimentation that the aliens obviously went through so that only raises more questions. At this time I'm halfway through the second game and very little more has been exposed. Other than that, the characters are flat and predictable including the main character. Any side characters besides MIA are quickly forgotten and seem to have no bearing on the game.   The gameplay itself is mildly entertaining. Most of the time you'll be navigating from one room to another to fix *enter ship system here* while gunning down a number of random aliens that are constantly trying to murder you. And....that's kind of the whole game. There really isn't much else to speak of. The guns are the generic AR, shotgun, flamethrower, pistol etc. The enemy variety is also on the bland side as most of them will charge you relentlessly no matter what. There's only one boss fight in the game and while slightly different from the normal gameplay, does nothing to change the status quo the game has already firmly set.  Overall, if you can get this game on sale (like it is currently), go for it. It's 5 hours of decent entertainment with maybe a few more hours stuffed in if you can find a co op partner. Just don't be looking for an incredible game with endless hours of fun in store, because it's simply not there.  Score - 6.5/10
Whoever designed the layout for this starship should be sued for inhibiting emergency response.
Fun little game, totally recommend it
it reminds me a little bit of Warhamer 40,000 Kill team
This game is great! at first glance I thought this was some run-of-the-mill shooting game. I've enjoyed every second that I have and will play! Hopefully the sequals are as good as this one!

Alien Breed comes in '3 Episodes' and if you like games like the Free2Play game Alien Swarm then you should try all three Episodes of Alien Breed. That would Be:  Alien Breed: Impact Alien Breed: Assault Alien Breed: Descent  Can recommend. Only flaw i found was the Co-op part of the game, its a stand alone four diffrent missions that you can play, and not the main campaign played in Co-op (Sadly). Later games even have survival mode.

Top down action/survival shooter. Great for gamepad. Very short because it's part of an episodic trilogy. The survival aspect is difficult, you have to be careful to not run out of ammo and get overwhelmed, this is why it's good to have a good co-op partner.

- really messed up control style, change this this line to TRUE bUsingFPSMouseAim=True in this file Steam\steamapps\common\Alien Breed Impact\AlienBreedEp1Game\Config\DefaultInput.ini' to fix this crappy controls  - too short, if you really rush you can probably finish entire game in under 2 hours  - only 6 weapons. and out of the 6 you really only need to use 2.  - cutscenes are done with comic-style stripes, no animation  - storyline sux and incomplete (continued in the 2 other Alien Breed games i think)  - always GO TO POINT A DO THIS AND THAT AND THEN GO TO POINT B, there's no puzzles or anything like that  - MOST ANNOYING thing about this game is the random explosion effects that goes off randomly around you that does NO damage but shakes your screen and stuff. at first it's kinda cool but then it just becomes annoying as hell.  on its own this game is 8 / 10.  compared to other games like Shadowgrounds which is an amazing game, or Alien Swarm, this game becomes 4 /10 at best.
Sweet legendary title reboot with actually good gameplay and complete atmosphere. I am looking for coop play with someone! :)
where is everybody gone, i just want play multiplayer because this multi mode is so¤¤¤ing interesting
Suprisingly good game. It's a ISO/action/shooter/dungeoncrawler. Will kill again in it. Decent replay value.
Fun gameplay, solid graphics, but extensive backtracking is a turnoff.
A solid top-down shooter. The novelty wears off pretty quick, but it's a short game. Lack of varied environments really bring the game down. Worth picking up at a deep discount.

I beat this game only 2 times took atleast 18 hours to beat. Alien Breed is based off the movie Alien so be prepared. If you want to live use your weapons wisely. If you a idiot you all your ammo and waste it. Just don't get caught in a horde of aliens. Oh and I think it the 2nd map you got a huge ♥♥♥♥ing alien chasing you. So watch your ♥♥♥ xD

Fun game. It didn't do so well in popularity since it competed with a free game released by steam in this games opening few weeks.  This game has a lot to offer. Can upgrade weapons and find different weapons. Even though I haven't upgraded everything yet, I feel I wanted more upgrades per weapon.
If you ever played the originals this is the game for you. If you're new to Alien Breed, go for it, you won't regret it.
Pretty fun. Checkpoints are a little dated, and call me spoiled, but I wish it had rechargeable health. I imagine it would be more fun in Coop.
7/10. Casual,repetitive,good storyline.

Really fun game! It's a battle for survival from unexpectant waves of aliens on a space ship that is slowly being torn apart! Great price for the Trilogy! It's a different twist on the usual alien-shooter games out there today, and I like it!

as a long-time fan of the Alien Breed franchise (at least the top-down ones) since the Amiga days, I was more than just a bit reluctant of seeing these new iterations of the games that I played and loved/hated during my youth (they were and still are among the most challenging games I've played, even in two-player) but I was pleasantly surprised by this game - it truly does 'feel' and [play] like an 'updated version' of a classic game [should be] sure it's not nearly as challenging, [mainly] due to the fact that you can actually [save your progress], but the 'feel' is there and it doesn't just 'look like a prettier version' of the classic, but rather what it sets out to be - an updated version of a classic  I am certain that if I was to analyze the game on a deeper level and compare it to other titles of the time of its release, I would certainly be able to find flaws and quirks, [but] this is a good ol' fashioned arcade-style shooter with upgradable weapons and a great atmosphere  my only gripe is that the multiplayer part still takes place on 'the same screen' (i.e. the players are unable to move outside of each-other's viewing range)  apart from that, I'd say that other companies from the era should look at this as a prime example of how to update your old classics in a way that stays true to its roots and at the same time adding nothing more but the necessities of keeping up with the times.

This game can go either way.For someone who remembers putting quarters at the arcade this might have some redeaming qualities.Also this could be like something you would play on your IPAD.Alien Breed is very repetitive to where it's best to play in hour installments.For what it's worth I did enjoy the game and it took me 15hrs. to beat.Graphics aren't the best but tolerable.Not much variety when it comes to enemy either.Thers is one lackluster boss battle at the end.This game also has alot of backtracking to it.This is a game I would suggest if you like these type of games.For this type of genre I give the game a 6 out of 10. SCORE 6

Decent top down shooter, much better with a friend, but the overall feeling of the game is anticlimactic, especially once you reach the larger creatures. Get it if you're looking for a casual shooter to mess around in, but nothing else.
Short but good.

Got this game as a bycatch from a bundle site. Guess what...it's interesting and challenging to find all things that are able to manipulate. Aliens aren't too strong on 'normal' level, so it's fun to play. Other then expected you look top-down...at first it's a bit weird, but you'll learn pretty fast.   If you get this one on a sale, it's defenetly worth it.

And it's time for a review! :)  Graphics : ✓ Cool ♥♥♥ looking machineries : ✓ Exploration : ✓  Action : ✓ Co-op : ✓ Cliff Hanger : ✓ Climbing up to the ceiling ? : ✓ Challenging Boss Fight : ✗ Bugs and Glitches : ✓  Pros :  - sick weapon upgrades - interesting battles - you can climb into the ceiling by foot - low system requirements but phenomenal graphics - you can get crushed by an alien :)  Cons :  - camera is a bit F and the map is a bit repetitive. - having only single boss fight - once you've upgraded the AR's power, everything seems to be easier - achievements are bit easy to achieve - the tentacle dude glitched out. I saw his insides, but the head is gone - didn't let me save the soldier trapped with those slimey creatures.
I have the older game and this one is way better than the old one.
If you like 'Alien Swarm' then this game will be fun for you. It has more detailed graphics and is a 3 part series. On top of all that, it is affordable.

I'll admit up front, I've only played the game for about an hour, the first full level in fact. That being said, I was pleasantly surprised by this game. It was not only great, it was much better than I honestly thought it would be. Shooters in general and top down view not usually in my list of favored genres.  But not only did I enjoy this, I could help but thinking that I would love to see this game and presumably its sequels remastered into a VR game for the Oculus Touch. Obviously for that it would have to be changed to FP instead of top down. But I think it would work well. This reminded a lot of the old Doom and Wolfenstein games in that's it's simple yet fun. Pick up a gun, shoot some stuff, find out how to unlock the door and shoot some more stuff. Sometimes it's the simplicity that makes the games the best.  If I had any complaints about the game thus far, it would be that the dialogue could be polished a little bit. During the opening conversation it was a little abrupt and wooden.

I managed to get to the end of this game... but it took more than six months, even though you can actually beat the campaign in less than 5 hours. I just found it really hard to get myself to play this game, and I did it just because it was waiting for me there with the rest of the trilogy in my steam library, and I've already got enough backlog. But yeah, playing this game felt almost like a chore. It is definitely playable and I guess you may like it if you enjoy the 'hack and slash' genre but in my opinion this game gets boring very fast and everything you do within it feels completely meaningless. The writing is horrible, the plot, if you can call it that, could as well not be there at all.   I'll sum up this game quickly for you: Go there, kill all the aliens that pop up along the way, come back to the place where you started. Repeat again. And again...and again. 'Sorry, your princess/generator is in another castle/part of the ship, go back through the same parts of the ship you have already ran through about 10 times and then come back here again.' Urgh, there is a fix number of times a gamer can go through the same corridor before he/she decides to stop playing. Oh, and the main protagonist looks a lot like a less cool Riddick. Conrad? Yeah, right.  I'll probably eventually play Alien Breed 2, but I suspect it will be more of the same and it'll probably take me another 6 months... At least as long as it concerns the first one in the series, I'd say I don't recommend it unless you love shooting at great number of enemies in a game with no plot whatsoever in isometric view. If that's your thing, then go for it because this is your game. The two positive things I can recall from playing is that I think it's cool they muted almost all sounds while out in space, and also I think that using comics to tell the story is a valid strategy, specially for those games with no great budgets. Overall, however, this game is definitely a no.
YouTube™ Video:  SteamPunk Episode 20: Alien Breed: Impact
At first glance this game looks promising but it's actually repetitive & boring.  2/10
Extremly boring, strange camera controls and alines look like free 3d models from Unity =)

This game....oh man this game...its so bad!   The whole 'campaign' is really dull and repetitive, consisting of the player running around doing chores for the computer-cyborg woman that you see briefly in the beginning cutscene.  So the story goes something like this: Your ship captain ♥♥♥♥ed up and rammed your ship into some colony/military/I dont ♥♥♥♥ing know space hulk that was swarming with aliens that kill everyone on your ship and continually try to eat you the whole time. Your character is this buffed out engineer that has the 'badass' voice about him and is supposed to be seen as a man that can get the job done with little to no words. However, he just comes out as someone that seems continually butthurt that he didnt get his latte for breakfast. He repairs the engine and shoots some aliens, he goes to hydroponics and shoots some aliens, and then he boards the big ♥♥♥ ship that you crashed into and shoots some aliens with bigger better guns. Game ends with the main character kinda face to face with the biggest alien he's ever seen and quite frankely looks like he's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ his pants with a streched frown on his face while muttering the words, 'Gotta go' to the cyborg woman that is like, 'the ♥♥♥♥ is going on over there?'. Thats the game. 9 and a half hours of running around and shooting aliens while flippin switches.  Yep. Pretty bad. Get Alien SWARM though, that game is free and is wayyyyy more kickass than this thing

do i have to play anymore of this

I'll try to keep this short, not only for those who don't feel like reading but because there isn't that much to say about this game.  I found this wasn't a very good game overall. Some elements were good but not enough to redeem it as a whole. Its a fast paced, isometric shooter in a futuristic sci-fi settings. You get a small selection of guns in which you use to kill aliens as you progress through one bland environment after another. The combat itself feels fairly solid even though some things like interacting with objects and movement feel clunky. Also, the story feels pretty tacked on to what is already a mediocre game.  Score: 5/10  (Maybe wait until the trilogy goes on sale for dirt cheap if you're looking to buy)
Seriously was not enjoyable.
I recommend that you not get this game.
Don't know why I got this, all I'm going to say is... I Do NOT recommend it!
This game is absolutely terrible. It's slow, it's clunky, and the multiplayer is awful. Don't waste your money on this game. I wouldn't play it if it were free.

Boring and repetitive, you basically backtrack on every level to click on doors and switches and shoot some aliens. There is nothing else ever done on any mission so just forget about that. The comic book style cutscenes are the only story that matters, they should have just made the comic book. The game does play well, but there is never anything of challenge. It's just shoot and use medpacks if you ever have to... you definitely don't. maybe on the hardest difficulty, but that would probably be because the aliens have too much health and they just kamikaze your face.   Buy something else...

This game is about as polished as something from 2005. Camera movement is manual, very close to the character, and most of the time you can't really see what you're aiming at.  Very mediocre execution of a very basic top/side down shooter.....
